definition: to look upon as/to regard as
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Catholics pray to Mary as an intercessor.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒向玛利亚祈祷，并把她看作仲裁者。

sentences.english: Chinese people has never regarded human beings as the hightest creature among everything else since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 中华民族自古以来从来不把人看作高于一切。

sentences.english: What if I saw myself as perfect?
sentences.chinese: 假如我已经将自己看作完美的呢？

sentences.english: The fugitives could not have taken this as an encouraging sign.
sentences.chinese: 这些逃亡者并没有被看作是鼓舞士气的事件。

sentences.english: All of phenomenology can be regarded as an unfolding of the idea of intentionality .
sentences.chinese: 所有的现象学都可以看作是意向性思想的延伸。

sentences.english: Yet this latest pause in Pakistan’s political turmoil is likely to be brief.
sentences.chinese: 然而在巴政治混乱中这次最新的停顿被看作是短暂的。

sentences.english: In Hitler's entourage this drawing was regarded as blasphemous.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒周围的人把我这幅画看作是侮漫不敬。

sentences.english: He took that as an auspice of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 他把那看作是幸福的征兆。

sentences.english: No other country thinks about food as just fueling up.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪个国家会把食物仅仅看作果腹之用。

sentences.english: I see it as another human variation.
sentences.chinese: ‘我把它看作是人类的变异之一。’

sentences.english: Magdalena considered the past an irrelevant encumbrance.
sentences.chinese: 玛格达莱娜把过去看作毫不相干的累赘。

sentences.english: What God looks on as obstinate weakness, we call strength.
sentences.chinese: 神看作顽梗的软弱，我们却称之为力量。

sentences.english: Still, I remained enamored of religion itself as an institution.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，我仍然将宗教看作一种习俗来迷恋。

sentences.english: De Gaulle was, at that time, considered a disloyal soldier.
sentences.chinese: 当时戴高乐被看作是一个不忠实的军人。

sentences.english: He sees life as continually, always already mediated by language.
sentences.chinese: 他将人生看作是连续的，永远可被语言调和。

sentences.english: It can be thought of as an instruction to a policy processing infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 对于策略处理基础架构来说，可以将其看作一条指令。

definition: to regard as/to look upon as
to regard as
to regard as/to treat as
to treat as/to regard as
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
to consider as/to take to be
to be called/to be known as
to liken to/to compare to
in fact/in reality/as a matter of fact/in practice
really isn't
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
opposite/contrary
to look upon/to regard
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
